args: (Though these may be my final moments,\nI will still fight... For there is someone\nwho expects greatness from me!)
I'm sorry, Mama, but I am an apostle...\nPlease forgive me for doing this without\nyour permission...
What are you doing, you fool creature?!\nYour foe is unarmed! KILL HER!
Unfortunately for you, so long as life beats\nin my breast, my arrow shall strike true!
Hey! Don't get all hot and bothered risking\nyour life against a scrub like this!
Looks like Papa Bear showed up\njust in time once again.
You really should try rolling with the flow\ninstead of this whole ＂staking my life on\none last desperate gambit＂ thing.
You know that'll make your mama Gabriel\ndo more than just cry.

Still, I can see how determined you are.
If I let a good one like you die without
stepping in, it would haunt me for the
rest of my days.
You! Are you an associate of the apostle?!

Nice to meet you, pops! I'm the bigger,
more grown-up model of apostle.
So, uh, what're you planning to do
with my little bunny junior here?

Oh, and that's not actually a question,
because I've already figured out your
entire scheme—so maybe just spare
us the trouble and come quietly, okay?
See, I was looking for a missing magical\nweapon, and I keep hearing rumors about\ndead people summoning monsters.
And why, I wondered, were those rumors\nspreading so far? So being a curious\nfellow, I hoofed it over here to Muskov.

That's when I learned some juicy tidbits
from my junior who was looking into this
town's secrets—tidbits about the kind of
folks who live here.
You mean about how there were no\nchildren or elderly?
Yep. Turns out there's a whole bunch of\npeople in the prime of their life who've\n＂died＂ in nearby towns of late.
So all the people who moved here...

Are dead—or at least the paperwork says
they are. The majority of 'em are actually
criminals who were imprisoned on
military bases throughout the region.

The bishop used his authority to commute
their sentences and guarantee them a new
life in return for absolute obedience, then
had 'em recorded as dead. Pretty slick.

...It would be no easy feat to fill an entire
city of this size with residents. But with
the backing of the principality, it would
be possible.
And in return for said backing, you sold\nthem Church secrets. Your behavior is\nunworthy of an adherent to the Goddess!

And that's not all. He's ALSO involved in
the theft of the magical weapon. It was
part of the process he used to create
these monsters.
They're a fusion of fiend and magical\nweapon.
How did you learn all of that?!
I had a hunch I'd get what I wanted, so\nI employed a little ＂persuasion＂ with\nsome soldiers in the neighboring town.
Please say you didn't harm them!
No! ...Well, not enough to make the\nbig lady upstairs angry, anyway.
Anyway, they told me everything I wanted\nto know about Bishop Scuzzbag here.\nSo how'd I do, Father? Close?

And if you HAVE stumbled on the truth?
What of it? Surely you're well aware that I
still have plenty of weapons with which to
silence your ever-flapping gums!
If this girl is anything to go by, the\npower of apostles is trivial at best;\nYou're no match for my monsters!
Both of you are bound for death, and all\nyou have accomplished is that I will be\ntwice the richer for it! Aaah ha ha ha!
Aaah ha ha! And with that, your brave\npartner has fallen. But do not mourn\novermuch; you will join him before long!
Wh-why? Why would you protect\na pathetic bungler like me?
Because taking that thing down ain't my\njob today—it's yours.
Papa Bear was so tired from gathering\nall that evidence, he decided to take a\nrest and leave this to you. Now go get 'em.
You can do ANYTHING if you try,\nso get out there and believe in yourself.\nI expect great things from you.
Right, then. I WILL do this!
Alpha! Separate her head from her\nshoulders and stop her pathetic mumbling!
Grant unto me the power of Gabriel,\nthe angel of Your divine majesty!
I am Pinon, the Wing of Purity!\nI am one hand of the Goddess,\nand I shall see Her will done!

...This concludes my report on
my mission. Bishop Roalta was put
to trial for heresy, and a new priest
was dispatched to Muskov.
Further, if you do not mind my saying so,\nI feel the Church should send a stern\nwarning to the Osborne Principality.
You have done well, Pinon. Dismissed.
Hey, Pinon. Finished with the reports?
Just now, yes—and thank you again for\nwhat you did before. Are you better?
Eh, it wasn't even that bad to begin with.\nPlus, you did a hell of a job protecting me.
You had the situation firmly in hand,\nyet gave me all the credit...

Did I? Yeah, I dunno. Details.
Anyhoo, how's it feel to be done
with the whole ＂first mission＂ thing?
You believe in yourself more now?
I do, thanks to your teachings.
That is why I will continue to believe in\nmyself—and also why I want to continue\ninvestigating this matter personally.

Even if the bishop is sent to face trial,
I suspect the collusion may be bigger than
just him. Where there is one traitorous
snake, there may well be others.
I possess the power to find those answers,\nand plan to see it done. So...
Don't go dying on me just yet.

Ha! I'm actually impressed right now.
Still, I'm sure my over-serious junior
will gallantly ride to my rescue if I
ever get in hot water.
Ha ha. Then I shall work hard to ensure\nI am always ready for that moment.
Next time, it will be I who saves the day\nand explains all to you! Just you wait!
